hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Breakout via 20D Volatility Compression
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) and BTC's 20-day realized volatility contracts below 35% while price consolidates within a 5% range for 10 days, a breakout above the consolidation high on >1.5x average volume will signal a transition to a BULL regime with an 80% probability of a 15%+ move in the direction of the breakout over the next 30 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low-volatility consolidation in neutral regimes often precedes significant directional moves. The combination of volatility compression, tight range, and high-volume breakout provides a high-probability signal of regime transition as institutional capital re-enters.
entry_conditions: BTC price range (high-low) over last 10 days < 5% of current price
BTC price breaks above 10-day consolidation high
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such signals result in false breakouts (return to range) or lead to BEAR regime instead of BULL within 30 days.
